perturbation.original_text:
1. TERM

As provided for in this Section 1, the term of this Agreement shall be for a period of five (5) years, beginning on the Effective Date (the "Initial Term"); provided, however, the Initial Term shall be subject to automatic successive renewal terms of three (3) years each (the "Renewal Terms" and together with the Initial Term, the "Term").
perturbation.changed_text:
1. TERM

As provided for in this Section 1, the term of this Agreement shall be for a period of five (5) years, beginning on the Effective Date (the "Initial Term"); provided, however, the Initial Term will be reviewed for successive renewal terms of three (3) years each (the "Renewal Terms" and together with the Initial Term, the "Term").
perturbation.explanation: The original text states the renewal term is 'automatic', but by changing that to 'will be reviewed', it creates a contradiction, implying that renewal is not guaranteed and will be subject to evaluation.

perturbation.original_text: 1.3. Distributor Credit. Except when this Agreement is terminated due to the uncured breach of Distributor, Distributor shall have within one (1) month of termination of this Agreement the right to return the Products purchased by Distributor to Vendor provided that the Products are unopened upon receipt by Vendor. Distributor will receive a credit for the full price paid by Distributor for the Products.
perturbation.changed_text: 1.3. Distributor Credit. Even if this Agreement is terminated due to the uncured breach of Distributor, Distributor may have within one (1) month of termination of this Agreement the right to return the Products purchased by Distributor to Vendor provided that the Products are unopened upon receipt by Vendor. Distributor may receive a credit for the full price paid by Distributor for the Products.
perturbation.explanation: The original text stated that except when there's an uncured breach, the distributor 'shall' have the right to return products and 'will' receive credit. By changing 'Except when' to 'Even if', and then by changing 'shall' to 'may' and 'will' to 'may', this removes the original statement's guarantee and makes it discretionary, which contradicts the certainty established previously.

perturbation.original_text: 5.5. Failure to Purchase. If Distributor fails to purchase or complete the purchase of the Products (or the payment thereof) in the quantities and the times specified in Section 5.1 of this Agreement, Vendor shall have the right to convert this Agreement from an exclusive grant of distribution rights to a non-exclusive grant of distribution rights by providing written notice to Distributor within fourteen (14) days of any date by which Distributor was obliged to purchase the specified quantity of Products as set in Section 5.1 of this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: 5.5. Failure to Purchase. If Distributor fails to purchase or complete the purchase of the Products (or the payment thereof) in the quantities and the times specified in Section 5.1 of this Agreement, Vendor may have the right to convert this Agreement from an exclusive grant of distribution rights to a non-exclusive grant of distribution rights by providing written notice to Distributor within fourteen (14) days of any date by which Distributor was obliged to purchase the specified quantity of Products as set in Section 5.1 of this Agreement. However, the vendor might extend the exclusivity of the distributor to the product in question.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states that Vendor 'shall' have the right to convert to non-exclusive. Now by changing shall to 'may', the first sentence introduces uncertainty and then, by adding the second sentence creates further confusion by suggesting the Vendor 'might' extend the exclusivity, directly contradicting the first.
